intro: Elaeoselinum hispanicum, commonly known as the Spanish fennel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill. The plant features slender, branched stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and aromatic foliage.
